page.title: 02Old Dailly Cemetery-Graves
page.content: There are different categories of{ {gravestones}in the {cemetery.} The Covenanters' graves are marked with tall pillars shaped into a pyramid at the top, with some surrounded by fences.The Covenanters were people who were executed for their {Protestant}faith, for which they had made a covenant to protect. The graves of the rich families have more elaborate stones with long lists of the deceased family names.One such family stone is that of the {Cumming } family from {Dailly.} The old graves of the ordinary local people have small stones with a skull and crossbones on them and a sand timer. Some graves also have plain slabs with writing on them although the { {poorest}local people commemorated the graves with bare boulders.
